Description: Neck, shoulder and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an olpe; interior glazed black at top of sherd, reserved below; exterior: black-figure decoration lion to left, looking back (part of head with mane in added red, mouth open with red tongue out and faded added white on teeth remaining).
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1232. For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 10650 in ABV p. 11, no. 11 and Agora XXIII, pl. 68, no. 704. For parallels regarding the open mouth, see Athens, Agora P 20645 in Agora XXIII, pl. 68, no. 711.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.20.6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 300, no. B294)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144, note 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0286) (Phase 1)
